name: African Elephant
description: The African Elephant is the largest land mammal, known for its intelligence and social structure.
food_note: Consumes up to 300 kg of food daily, foraging for hours.
proportions: Height: 3-4 m, length: 6-7.5 m, weight: 2,000-7,000 kg.
reproduction: Gestation about 22 months, one calf born.
attractions: Iconic in zoos for their size and emotional displays.
projects_note: Endangered due to poaching and habitat loss; conservation is critical.
breeding: Bred in captivity, but challenging due to space needs.
